qas.question: Who led the first insurrection in Europe in 1848?
Who was the first president of Palermo?
Who regained control of Palermo in 1849?
Sicily and Palermo became part of what Kingdom in 1861?
Who led an insurrection in the 18th century?
Who was the first president of Palermo?
Who reconqured Palermo in the 18th century?

context: From 1820 to 1848 Sicily was shaken by upheavals, which culminated on 12 January 1848, with a popular insurrection, the first one in Europe that year, led by <a0_0><b4_0>Giuseppe La Masa<a0_0/>.<b4_0/> A parliament and constitution were proclaimed. The first president was <a1_0><b5_0>Ruggero Settimo<b5_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0><b6_0>The Bourbons<b6_0/><a2_0/> reconquered Palermo in 1849, and remained under their rule until the time of <b7_0>Giuseppe Garibaldi<b7_0/>. The famous general entered Palermo with his troops (the “Thousands”) on 27 May 1860. After the plebiscite later that year Palermo, along with the rest of Sicily, became part of the new <a3_0>Kingdom of Italy<a3_0/> (1861).
